KS2 & SATs Maths Tuition

Building unshakeable confidence for Year 6 SATs and a flying start to Secondary School.

Check Availability View Curriculum
THE REALITY

Why students struggle at this level.

  • The 'Word Problem' Wall: Students who can do sums but freeze when asked a written reasoning question.
  • SATs Anxiety: The pressure of the first 'real' exams in Year 6.
  • Slow Mental Maths: Struggling to finish the Arithmetic Paper in time.
  • The 'Bad at Maths' Label: Falling behind in class and believing they just can't do it.
The GG Method

How we secure the top grades.

  • Paper 1 Mastery: We drill arithmetic shortcuts to ensure they get full marks on the first paper, boosting confidence instantly.
  • Reasoning Translators: Teaching kids how to highlight keywords and translate English sentences into maths sums.
  • Visualising Fractions: Using pizza slices, bars, and blocks to make abstract concepts like '3/4 of 20' obvious.
  • Secondary Readiness: We don't just teach to the test; we ensure they are ready for the jump to Year 7 algebra.
Secure your KS2 & SATs Maths Grade

More Than Just Tutoring

A holistic approach designed for high performance.

Positive Reinforcement

At this age, confidence is fragile. We celebrate every small win to build a 'growth mindset', proving to them that practice makes progress.

Exam Technique

SATs require speed. We gently introduce timed conditions so that on the big day, the ticking clock isn't scary—it's normal.

Concrete to Abstract

We don't just write numbers. We draw diagrams and use physical examples. Once they 'see' the maths, the method sticks forever.

Common Questions

When should we start SATs preparation?

Ideally in Year 5. This allows us to cover the syllabus gently and fix foundation gaps (like times tables) without the 'cramming' panic in Year 6.

My child gets bored easily. How do you keep them engaged?

Our KS2 sessions are shorter-paced, gamified, and interactive. We switch topics frequently and use screen-sharing tools to let the student 'write' on the board.

What is 'Greater Depth'?

This is the highest standard in SATs. We push able students beyond the basics, teaching them how to apply maths to complex, multi-step problems.

Do you cover homework help?

Yes. If they are stuck on school homework, we can use the start of the lesson to clear up confusion so they don't fall behind in class.
